Module kivakit.data.formats.csv
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.csv

Class CsvReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.iteration.BaseIterator<T>
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.resource.reading.BaseObjectReader<CsvLine>
        • com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.csv.CsvReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, Trait, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, RepeaterTrait, Transceiver, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.Iterator<CsvLine>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnquotedCsvReader
    public class CsvReader
extends BaseObjectReader<CsvLine>
    Parses a stream of CSV information. The rules outlined here dictate valid CSV format. In particular, this class can handle quoted strings, line breaks within quotes, comments, empty lines, and some of the other standard formatting issues.

    Processing CSV Lines

    A reader instance is constructed with CsvReader(Resource, CsvSchema, char, ProgressReporter). Since the class is Iterable, lines can then be retrieved as objects with code similar to: 

     try (var reader = new CsvReader(resource, schema, ',', ProgressReporter.NULL))
 {
     for (var line : reader)
     {
         var employee = line.asObject(Employee.class);

         [...]
     }
 }
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    CsvSchema, Resource, ProgressReporter, CsvLine
